verse.roman:
gamyatāṁ śakra bhadraṁ vaḥ
kriyatāṁ me 'nuśāsanam
sthīyatāṁ svādhikāreṣu
yuktair vaḥ stambha-varjitaiḥ

synonyms: gamyatām—you may go; śakra—O Indra; bhadram—good fortune; vaḥ—unto you; kriyatām—you should execute; me—My; anuśāsanam—order; sthīyatām—you may remain; sva—in your own; adhikāreṣu—responsibilities; yuktaiḥ—soberly engaged; vaḥ—you; stambha—false pride; varjitaiḥ—devoid of.
translation: Indra, you may now go. Execute My order and remain in your appointed position as King of heaven. But be sober, without false pride.

purport.text: Lord Kṛṣṇa here addresses Indra in the plural form (vaḥ) because this grave instruction was meant to be a lesson for all the demigods.
